info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 6:29PM CDT until June 18 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following counties, Boone, Ogle and Winnebago.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicates the heaviest rainfall is shifting east of the advisory area. However, isolated heavier rainfall rates persist. Automated rainfall gauges indicate between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, and additional isolated amounts near an inch will be possible leading to a continued threat for flooding through early this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockford, Belvidere, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Roscoe, South Beloit, Rockton, Poplar Grove, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Polo, Rockford Airport, Candlewick Lake, Cherry Valley, Winnebago, Davis Junction, Pecatonica, Forreston and Stillman Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Boone, IL; Ogle, IL; Winnebago, IL
